organization.name: Endeavor Health Behavioral Health Network
organization.description: The largest integrated behavioral health network in Illinois, providing comprehensive mental health services across multiple locations.

levelsOfCare.name: Assessment & Referral
levelsOfCare.description: A confidential evaluation by a licensed professional to recommend the appropriate level of treatment based on symptoms and acuity. Same day appointments are available.

levelsOfCare.name: Partial Hospitalization Program (PHP)
levelsOfCare.description: Full-day program (5-6 hours/day), 5 days a week. Group-based programs that provide intensive, structured daily programming to support individuals with depression, anxiety, substance use, eating disorders, or trauma. Daytime and evening options are available.

levelsOfCare.name: Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP)
levelsOfCare.description: Half-day program (3-3.5 hours/day), 5 days a week. Group-based programs that provide intensive, structured daily programming to support individuals with depression, anxiety, substance use, eating disorders, or trauma. Daytime and evening options are available.

levelsOfCare.name: Inpatient
levelsOfCare.description: Hospitalization for adolescents, adults, and older adults dealing with severe behavioral health challenges like depression, anxiety, addiction, psychosis, trauma, eating disorders, and more. Our inpatient program provides 24/7 care in a structured environment, with close monitoring and daily sessions with therapists and psychiatrists.

levelsOfCare.name: Psychiatric Services
levelsOfCare.description: Psychiatrists and advanced practice providers provide medication management and individual therapy.

levelsOfCare.name: Counseling
levelsOfCare.description: Therapists provide traditional outpatient talk therapy.

levelsOfCare.name: Medication Management
levelsOfCare.description: Psychiatrists, PAs and APNs help patients manage and regulate their medication.

specializedPrograms.name: Mental Health Program
specializedPrograms.description: Support for depression, anxiety, psychosis and other mental health challenges.

specializedPrograms.name: Addictions and Dual Diagnosis
specializedPrograms.description: A program for each stage of the addiction and recovery process, including dual diagnosis, detoxification, and group therapy.

subPrograms.name: OARS
subPrograms.description: Advanced care for substance use recovery, including alcohol and opioids, with a multidisciplinary team addressing co-occurring mental health needs.

specializedPrograms.name: Anxiety and OCD
specializedPrograms.description: General mental health program to treat any anxiety disorders, including OCD.

subPrograms.name: Child Anxiety Program
subPrograms.description: Program to assist children in comprehending, managing, and tolerating their anxiety.

specializedPrograms.name: Eating Disorders
specializedPrograms.description: Specialized inpatient care for eating disorders, led by a multidisciplinary team offering the latest techniques for treating those struggling with anorexia, bulimia, and other related conditions.

specializedPrograms.name: PTSD and Trauma
specializedPrograms.description: Highly effective, short-term, group-based therapy for people with PTSD or Trauma.

specializedPrograms.name: Autism & Mental Health Program - Aspirations
specializedPrograms.description: Program designed to assist adolescents with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) in effectively managing anxiety and/or depression.

specializedPrograms.name: TMS
specializedPrograms.description: Advanced treatment designed to help patients struggling with conditions like depression, depression with anxiety, OCD, and smoking addiction.

specializedPrograms.name: Psychosis Program
specializedPrograms.description: Program for individuals experiencing significant mental health challenges, focusing on improving academic, work, social, and daily functioning impacted by psychosis.

specializedPrograms.name: Evening Creative Arts Program
specializedPrograms.description: Group-based program that incorporates Art Therapy, Music Therapy, Dance/Movement Therapy, Animal-Assisted Therapy, Horticultural Therapy, Recreation Therapy, and Occupational Therapy.

specializedPrograms.name: Emerging Adult Program
specializedPrograms.description: Tailored to young adults struggling with mental health challenges while navigating the transition to adulthood. We utilize Acceptance and Commitment Therapy and Motivational Interviewing to support growth and resilience.

specializedPrograms.name: Geriatric Mental Health
specializedPrograms.description: Support designed specifically for older adults, addressing conditions such as depression, anxiety, and age-related concerns with a focus on comprehensive support.

treatmentModalities.name: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy that uses acceptance and mindfulness strategies to increase psychological flexibility.

treatmentModalities.name: Art Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy involving the encouragement of free self-expression through painting, drawing, or modeling.

treatmentModalities.name: Attachment/Relational Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A therapeutic approach focusing on the attachment relationships formed early in life and how they affect current relationships.

treatmentModalities.name: Bio Feedback
treatmentModalities.description: A technique that trains people to improve their health by controlling certain bodily processes that normally happen involuntarily.

treatmentModalities.name: Client Centered
treatmentModalities.description: A non-directive form of talk therapy developed by humanist psychologist Carl Rogers where the client takes the lead in sessions.

treatmentModalities.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A psycho-social intervention that aims to improve mental health by challenging and changing cognitive distortions and behaviors.

treatmentModalities.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia
treatmentModalities.description: A structured program that helps you identify and replace thoughts and behaviors that cause or worsen sleep problems with habits that promote sound sleep.

treatmentModalities.name: Cognitive Processing Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A specific type of cognitive behavioral therapy that has been effective in reducing symptoms of PTSD.

treatmentModalities.name: Structural Family Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A therapy that examines and changes the family structure to allow it to develop healthier patterns.

treatmentModalities.name: Couples
treatmentModalities.description: Therapy focused on helping couples recognize and resolve conflicts to improve their relationship.

treatmentModalities.name: Critical Incident Debriefing
treatmentModalities.description: A process that prevents or limits the development of post-traumatic stress in people exposed to critical incidents.

treatmentModalities.name: Dialectical Behavior Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A modified form of cognitive-behavioral therapy that treats conditions where emotional regulation is difficult.

treatmentModalities.name: Eclectic
treatmentModalities.description: An approach that draws upon multiple theoretical frameworks to develop the optimal treatment for each individual.

treatmentModalities.name: Emotion Efficacy Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A brief, skills-based intervention that combines elements of acceptance and commitment therapy with emotion regulation skills.

treatmentModalities.name: Emotion Focused Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A therapy approach that focuses on helping people become aware of, experience, accept, express, utilize, regulate, and transform emotions.

treatmentModalities.name: Electroconvulsive Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A procedure, done under general anesthesia, in which small electric currents are passed through the brain, intentionally triggering a brief seizure to quickly reverse symptoms of certain mental health conditions.

treatmentModalities.name: Enhanced Cognitive Behavior Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A type of CBT specifically enhanced for the treatment of eating disorders.

treatmentModalities.name: Exposure Response Prevention
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy that was developed to treat obsessive-compulsive disorder by exposing patients to feared stimuli while preventing the ritualistic response.

treatmentModalities.name: Expressive
treatmentModalities.description: A therapeutic approach that uses creative activities to help people express their thoughts and feelings.

treatmentModalities.name: Family
treatmentModalities.description: A type of psychological counseling that helps family members improve communication and resolve conflicts.

treatmentModalities.name: Family Systems
treatmentModalities.description: A therapy that views problems within the family as a result of the system's dysfunction rather than as a result of individual members' issues.

treatmentModalities.name: Gestalt
treatmentModalities.description: A humanistic therapy that focuses on the individual's experience in the present moment and the relationships between people and their environment.

treatmentModalities.name: Gottman
treatmentModalities.description: A research-based approach to relationships that focuses on strengthening the friendship between partners and managing conflict constructively.

treatmentModalities.name: Group Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy in which a group of patients meet to discuss and explore their personal problems together under the supervision of a therapist.

treatmentModalities.name: Hypnotherapy/Hypnosis
treatmentModalities.description: A type of complementary medicine that uses guided relaxation, intense concentration, and focused attention to achieve a heightened state of awareness.

treatmentModalities.name: Internal Family Systems
treatmentModalities.description: A model of psychotherapy that believes the mind is naturally multiple, composed of sub-personalities or 'parts' that can be healed and transformed through the relationship with the core Self.

treatmentModalities.name: Medication Assisted Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: The use of medications, in combination with counseling and behavioral therapies, to provide a whole-patient approach to the treatment of substance use disorders.

treatmentModalities.name: Meditation
treatmentModalities.description: A practice where an individual uses a technique – such as mindfulness, or focusing the mind on a particular object, thought, or activity – to train attention and awareness.

treatmentModalities.name: Mind Body Connection
treatmentModalities.description: A therapy that emphasizes the interaction between brain, mind, body, and behavior, and the ways in which emotional, mental, social, spiritual, and behavioral factors can directly affect health.

treatmentModalities.name: Mindfulness Based Cognitive
treatmentModalities.description: A psychological therapy that uses traditional cognitive behavioral therapy methods together with mindfulness meditative practices.

treatmentModalities.name: Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction
treatmentModalities.description: An intensive mindfulness training program that helps you access your inner resources for coping, growing, and healing.

treatmentModalities.name: Motivational Interviewing
treatmentModalities.description: A counseling method that helps people resolve ambivalent feelings and insecurities to find the internal motivation they need to change their behavior.

treatmentModalities.name: Narrative Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy that seeks to help people identify their values and the skills associated with them by examining the stories of their lives.

treatmentModalities.name: Neurofeedback
treatmentModalities.description: A type of biofeedback that uses real-time displays of brain activity to teach self-regulation of brain function.

treatmentModalities.name: Neuropsychological Testing
treatmentModalities.description: A comprehensive evaluation of cognitive, motor, behavioral, linguistic, and executive functioning to assess brain functioning.

treatmentModalities.name: Parent Child Interaction Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A family-centered treatment approach that helps improve the quality of the parent-child relationship and change parent-child interaction patterns.

treatmentModalities.name: Person Centered Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A non-directive talk therapy approach that emphasizes the personal relationship between therapist and client.

treatmentModalities.name: Play Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of therapy primarily used with children to help them express their feelings and deal with emotional problems through play activities.

treatmentModalities.name: Psychodynamic Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of depth psychology, the primary focus of which is to reveal the unconscious content of a client's psyche in an effort to alleviate psychic tension.

treatmentModalities.name: Psychological Testing
treatmentModalities.description: The administration of psychological tests to assess a variety of mental abilities and attributes.

treatmentModalities.name: Psychopharmacology
treatmentModalities.description: The use of medications in treating mental disorders.

treatmentModalities.name: Rapid Resolution Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of psychotherapy that aims to help resolve the ongoing effects of trauma, abuse, panic, anxiety, and anger by clearing negative emotions connected to traumatic events.

treatmentModalities.name: Rational Emotive Behavioral Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A type of cognitive-behavioral therapy that helps identify irrational beliefs, challenge these beliefs, and replace them with healthier, more productive beliefs.

treatmentModalities.name: Sand Tray
treatmentModalities.description: A form of expressive therapy that enables a person to explore their thoughts and feelings through the creation of a three-dimensional scene in a tray filled with sand.

treatmentModalities.name: Solutions Focused Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A goal-directed collaborative approach to psychotherapeutic change that focuses on what clients want to achieve without exploring the history of the problem.

treatmentModalities.name: Somatic Experience
treatmentModalities.description: A type of therapy that focuses on bodily sensations to help heal from trauma and other mental and emotional health issues.

treatmentModalities.name: Strengths Based Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A type of therapy that focuses on a person's strengths and capabilities rather than weaknesses or issues.

treatmentModalities.name: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation
treatmentModalities.description: A noninvasive procedure that uses magnetic fields to stimulate nerve cells in the brain to improve symptoms of depression.

treatmentModalities.name: Trauma Informed
treatmentModalities.description: A treatment approach that emphasizes understanding, recognizing, and responding to the effects of all types of trauma.

treatmentModalities.name: Yoga
treatmentModalities.description: A mind and body practice with a 5,000-year history in ancient Indian philosophy that combines physical postures, breathing exercises, meditation, and a distinct philosophy.

treatmentModalities.name: Music Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: The clinical and evidence-based use of music interventions to accomplish individualized goals within a therapeutic relationship.

treatmentModalities.name: Dance/Movement Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: The psychotherapeutic use of movement to promote emotional, social, cognitive, and physical integration.

treatmentModalities.name: Animal-Assisted Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A type of therapy that involves animals as a form of treatment to improve a patient's social, emotional, or cognitive functioning.

treatmentModalities.name: Horticultural Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A process that uses plants and gardening to improve physical and mental health.

treatmentModalities.name: Recreation Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A systematic process that utilizes recreation and other activity-based interventions to address the needs of individuals with illnesses or disabling conditions.

treatmentModalities.name: Occupational Therapy
treatmentModalities.description: A form of therapy for those recovering from physical or mental illness that encourages rehabilitation through the performance of activities required in daily life.

conditions.name: ADHD
conditions.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by persistent patterns of inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity that interferes with functioning or development.

conditions.name: Addiction
conditions.description: A complex condition characterized by compulsive substance use despite harmful consequences.

conditions.name: Age-Related Concerns
conditions.description: Mental health concerns specific to older adults, which may include cognitive changes, adjustment to life transitions, grief, and isolation.

conditions.name: Anger Management
conditions.description: Difficulties controlling anger, which may lead to impulsive behavior, strained relationships, or legal consequences.

conditions.name: Anorexia Nervosa
conditions.description: An eating disorder characterized by an abnormally low body weight, intense fear of gaining weight, and a distorted perception of body weight.

conditions.name: Anxiety
conditions.description: A mental health condition characterized by feelings of worry, anxiety, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with daily activities.

conditions.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
conditions.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by challenges with social skills, repetitive behaviors, speech and nonverbal communication.

conditions.name: Behavior Issues
conditions.description: Disruptive, problematic, or challenging behaviors that interfere with daily life, relationships, or normal development.

conditions.name: Bulimia Nervosa
conditions.description: An eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by methods to avoid weight gain, such as self-induced vomiting, fasting, or excessive exercise.

conditions.name: Depression
conditions.description: A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest, affecting how one feels, thinks, and behaves.

conditions.name: Dual Diagnosis
conditions.description: The co-occurrence of both a mental health disorder and a substance use disorder, requiring integrated treatment approaches.

conditions.name: Eating Disorders
conditions.description: Serious conditions related to persistent eating behaviors that negatively impact health, emotions, and ability to function in important areas of life.

conditions.name: Grief
conditions.description: The natural emotional response to loss, particularly the loss of someone or something to which a bond was formed.

conditions.name: Life Transitions
conditions.description: Significant life changes such as relocation, career changes, marriage, divorce, or retirement that can cause stress and adjustment difficulties.

conditions.name: Mood Disorders
conditions.description: A category of mental health problems that includes all types of depression and bipolar disorder, characterized by serious changes in mood.

conditions.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
conditions.description: A mental health condition characterized by unwanted, intrusive thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors or mental acts (compulsions).

conditions.name: Personality Disorders
conditions.description: A class of mental health conditions characterized by rigid and unhealthy patterns of thinking, functioning, and behaving.

conditions.name: Psychosis
conditions.description: A condition that affects the mind where there is a loss of contact with reality, characterized by changes in thinking, perception, feelings, and behavior.

conditions.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
conditions.description: A condition that may develop after experiencing or witnessing a traumatic, terrifying, or shocking event.

conditions.name: Relationships/Family Problems
conditions.description: Challenges or conflicts within personal relationships, families, or marriages that cause significant distress.

conditions.name: Substance Use
conditions.description: The use of drugs or alcohol that causes clinically significant impairment, including health problems, disability, and failure to meet major responsibilities.

conditions.name: Trauma
conditions.description: Psychological response to a deeply distressing or disturbing event that overwhelms an individual's ability to cope.

conditions.name: Transition Issues
conditions.description: Challenges associated with important life changes, particularly for adolescents and young adults navigating the transition to adulthood.

ageGroups.name: Children
ageGroups.description: Treatment services specifically designed for children between the ages of 8 and 11.

ageGroups.name: Adolescents
ageGroups.description: Treatment services designed for teenagers between the ages of 12 and 17.

ageGroups.name: Adults
ageGroups.description: Treatment services for adults age 18 and older.

ageGroups.name: Older Adults
ageGroups.description: Specialized treatment services addressing the unique mental health needs of older adults.

specializations.name: Addictions and co-occurring disorders
specializations.description: Specialized treatment for substance use disorders and addiction, often occurring alongside other mental health conditions.

specializations.name: ADHD
specializations.description: Treatment for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder and related executive functioning challenges.

specializations.name: Anger management
specializations.description: Therapeutic approaches to help individuals understand and manage anger responses.

specializations.name: Anxiety
specializations.description: Treatment for various anxiety disorders including generalized anxiety, social anxiety, panic disorder, and phobias.

specializations.name: Behavior Issues
specializations.description: Interventions for problematic or disruptive behaviors that interfere with daily functioning.

specializations.name: Depression
specializations.description: Treatment for various forms of depression, from mild to severe, including major depressive disorder.

specializations.name: Grief
specializations.description: Supportive therapy for individuals experiencing grief and bereavement.

specializations.name: Life transitions
specializations.description: Support for navigating major life changes such as career transitions, relocations, or relationship changes.

specializations.name: Marriage/couples therapy
specializations.description: Therapy focused on improving communication and resolving conflicts between partners.

specializations.name: Mood disorders
specializations.description: Treatment for conditions characterized by disturbances in mood, including depression and bipolar disorder.

specializations.name: Personality disorders
specializations.description: Specialized treatment for deeply ingrained, maladaptive patterns of behavior and inner experience.

specializations.name: Relationships/family problems
specializations.description: Therapy focused on improving family dynamics and resolving interpersonal conflicts.

specializations.name: Trauma
specializations.description: Specialized treatment for psychological trauma, including post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
